Package civitas.celestis.event

package civitas.celestis.event

Event

This package contains a lightweight and versatile event management system. The interface Handleable is used to define the contract of an event, and the Listener and EventHandler interfaces mark the presence of an event handler method.

The module EventManager can either be used directly (by the class SyncEventManager, or by implementing a custom class to handle event management.

Events have two fields by default: a unique identifier and a cause. These two fields can be used to identify and determine the cause of the event.

See Also:
  • Handleable
  • Event
  • Listener
  • EventHandler
  • EventManager
  • Class
    Description
    Event
    The base class for an event.
    EventHandler
    A marker annotation which marks a method as an event handler.
    EventManager
    An event manager.
    EventThread
    An event processing thread.
    Handleable
    A marker interface which makes a class callable into an event manager.
    HandlerPriority
    The priority of an event handler.
    HandlerReference
    A reference to an event handler.
    Listener
    A marker interface which marks an object as an event listener.
    SyncEventManager
    A perfectly synchronized event manager with only one thread.
